Reason: The 'keyspace_count_warn_threshold' configuration does not directly involve any performance-related operations that are time-extensive or memory-extensive within its related code. It simply sets a threshold for the number of keyspaces in the cluster and triggers a warning message when the threshold is exceeded. This warning message is meant to inform the user about potential performance issues related to having a large number of keyspaces, but the configuration itself does not cause notable performance variations at the system level. Therefore, it is not classified as performance-sensitive.
